definition: to do/to grow/to write or compose/to pretend/to regard as/to feel/writings or works
to cross/to go over/to pass (time)/to celebrate (a holiday)/to live/to get along/excessively/too-
to pass/to spend (time)/measure/limit/extent/degree of intensity/degree (angles, temperature etc)/kilowatt-hour/classifier for events and occurrences

sentences.english: When your boss applies for leave, it's because he's overworked .
sentences.chinese: 當你的老闆申請假期，因爲他工作過度了。
工作過度可能會危害你的健康。

sentences.english: Workers complain to the boss of their overwork.
sentences.chinese: 因爲工作過度，工人向老闆訴苦。

sentences.english: Listen to your body. If you are working too much you will start feeling tired, cranky and apathetic.
sentences.chinese: 工作過度的你會發覺你正變得疲累，暴躁和冷淡。

sentences.english: What with overwork and what with undernourishment, he became weaker and weaker.
sentences.chinese: 半因工作過度半因營養不良，他越來越虛弱了。

sentences.english: Yes, Sir, they work excessiveness weariness from overwork dead.
sentences.chinese: 是的，先生，它們工作過度勞累死了。

sentences.english: His health was the forfeit he paid for overworking.
sentences.chinese: 他因工作過度而喪失了健康。

sentences.english: To wear out, as by overuse or overindulgence.
sentences.chinese: 使疲憊使疲憊不堪，如因工作過度或放縱慾望。

sentences.english: It is generally assumed that stress is caused by overwork.
sentences.chinese: 普遍認爲緊張是工作過度所致。
